name: asset_info
description: Describes the addressing, version, and ownership of an asset.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</abbr> for this file, relative to a content root folder.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string representing a hint of how to load the file.

properties.name: contributor
properties.description: A contributor object representing a person or entity that worked on the asset.

properties.name: revision
properties.description: A string representing the revision number for the file.

properties.name: modified
properties.description: A date_time representing the given revision of the file.

details:
The id indicates the file path that should be used for the file containing this definition. The file path should always begin with a leading ‘/’ and is understood to be relative to the content directory root folder.

Assets within a DSF file are assumed to “live” together forever so that asset addressing of assets within the file may remain constant. If it is necessary to update the assets within a previously deployed file and re-deploy it, the revision number should be incremented to allow differentiation between the original file and the updated file. How the revision field is interpreted is application-defined.

name: bulge_binding
description: Defines a bulge binding that appears in the bulge_weights collection of a weighted joint.

properties.name: bulges
properties.description: An array of four channel_float objects representing the “positive-left”, “positive-right”, “negative-left”, and “negative-right” channel values.

properties.name: left_map
properties.description: A float_indexed_array representing the left vertex map.

properties.name: right_map
properties.description: A float_indexed_array representing the right vertex map.

name: camera
description: Extra properties available for use if the node type is specified as “camera”.

properties.name: perspective
properties.description: A camera_perspective object definition, if this is a perspective camera.

properties.name: orthographic
properties.description: An camera_orthographic object definition, if this is an orthographic camera.

name: camera_orthographic
description: Defines properties of an orthographic camera.

properties.name: znear
properties.description: The near clipping plane

properties.name: zfar
properties.description: The far clipping plane

properties.name: ymag
properties.description: View magnification along the vertical (y) axis.

name: camera_perspective
description: Defines properties of a perspective camera.

properties.name: znear
properties.description: The near clipping plane

properties.name: zfar
properties.description: The car clipping plane

properties.name: yfov
properties.description: Field of view along the vertical (y) axis, in degrees.

properties.name: focal_length
properties.description: Focal length

properties.name: depth_of_field
properties.description: If this camera should do depth of field

properties.name: focal_distance
properties.description: Focal distance

properties.name: fstop
properties.description: F stop for the camera

name: channel
description: This is an abstract object that contains the common properties for all channel types.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing a unique ID within the property scope of the containing object.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string representing the data type of the channel. Valid values are “alias”, “bool”, “color”, “enum”, “float”, “image”, “int” and “string”. See Extended By.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the internal name to apply to this channel. An empty string is not a valid name.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing a user-facing label to apply to this channel.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: A boolean value representing a <abbr title="User Interface">UI</abbr> hint, indicating whether or not the parameter should be shown.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the parameter is allowed to be changed.

properties.name: auto_follow
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the channel should automatically be connected to a corresponding channel during conforming.

details: The ID of a channel does not have to be unique within file scope because it is not an “asset” and its addressing is always via property addressing, so must only be unique within the scope of the containing/owning object.

name: channel_alias
description: Channels that exist on an object may be aliased to appear on another object. This allows control of the channel from more than one location. A channel_alias simply reflects the target_channel properties and values.

properties.name: target_channel
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> referring to the channel that this channel is an alias of.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_animation
description: Defines an animation sequence for a single channel.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Description

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> referring to the channel to target with this animation.

properties.name: keys
properties.description: An array of time/value pairs, with an optional nested array that defines  an interpolation type and its associated values (if any), one for each keyframe.

details:
Keys must appear in order of ascending time. The number of values specified for each key must match the number of components of the property specified in the url. To provide animation data for a single component of a multi-component property, use the sub-property selector syntax (see Asset Addressing) to specify which component is desired, then provide the number of values required to specify a value for keys of that type.

The assumed key interpolation type is Catmull-Rom Spline Tangent for float channels and Linear for all others.

name: channel_bool
description: Defines properties of a boolean-valued channel. Only determinate true and false values are supported. Indeterminate boolean states (tri-states) are not supported.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Description

properties.name: min
properties.description: An int representing the minimum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: max
properties.description: An int representing the maximum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: clamped
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not min and max are enforced.

properties.name: step_size
properties.description: An int representing the step size, or paging size, to use for this parameter when presenting UI to the user. Effectively a scaling value. Value applies to all components of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A boolean value representing the default value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: A boolean value representing the current value for the parameter.

properties.name: mappable
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the channel is mappable.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.
example:
{
	"id" : "Multiply Specular Through Opacity",
	"type" : "bool",
	"name" : "Multiply Specular Through Opacity",
	"label" : "Multiply Specular Through Opacity",
	"value" : true
}

name: channel_color
description: Defines properties of a vector-valued color channel where color is represented as a three-component floating point RGB value.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A float3 representing the default color value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: A float3 representing the current color value for the parameter.

properties.name: mappable
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the channel is mappable.

details:
Color values are assumed to be in the range 0.0 to 1.0, but floating point values outside that range are legal and it is up to the application to determine how to interpret those.

The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_enum
description: Defines properties of an enum-valued channel. A channel_enum channel type can support a pre-determined mapping from a string to an integer index value.

properties.name: value
properties.description: An int representing the default index value for the parameter.

properties.name: enum_values
properties.description: An array of string values representing the enumerated values for the parameter.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_float
description: Defines properties of a floating-point value channel.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A float value representing the default value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: A float value representing the current value for the parameter.

properties.name: min
properties.description: A float value representing the minimum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: max
properties.description: A float value representing the maximum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: clamped
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not min and max are enforced.

properties.name: display_as_percent
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the parameter value should be shown to the user as a percentage.

properties.name: step_size
properties.description: A float value representing the step size, or paging size, to use for this parameter when presenting UI to the user. Effectively a scaling value. Value applies to all components of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: mappable
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the channel is mappable.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_image
description: Defines properties of an image-valued channel. A channel_image channel type is used to create and address animatable channels that allow switching of an entire image at once.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A string representing the default value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: A string representing the current value for the parameter.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_int
description: Defines properties of a integer-valued channel.

properties.name: value
properties.description: An int value representing the default value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: An int value representing the current value for the parameter.

properties.name: min
properties.description: An int value representing the minimum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: max
properties.description: An int value representing the maximum value for the parameter, or for each component of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: clamped
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not min and max are enforced.

properties.name: step_size
properties.description: An int value representing the step size, or paging size, to use for this parameter when presenting UI to the user. Effectively a scaling value. Value applies to all components of a vector-valued channel.

properties.name: mappable
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether or not the channel is mappable.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: channel_string
description: Defines properties of a string-valued channel.

properties.name: value
properties.description: A string representing the default value for the parameter.

properties.name: current_value
properties.description: A string representing the current value for the parameter.

details: The current_value attribute is overridden anytime an animation is associated with the channel.

name: contributor
description: Information about an individual contributor.

properties.name: author
properties.description: A string representing the name of the contributor.

properties.name: email
properties.description: A string representing the email address of the contributor.

properties.name: website
properties.description: A string representing the contributor's web site, if any.

details: This is an optional object that represents original author identification and contact info.

name: DAZ
description: A DAZ object is the top level object in a DSON format file.

properties.name: file_version
properties.description: A string indicating the file format schema version to be used when parsing the file, in the form “major.minor.revision”.

properties.name: asset_info
properties.description: A base-level asset_info object to apply to all assets within the file.

properties.name: geometry_library
properties.description: An array of geometry assets defined in this file.

properties.name: node_library
properties.description: An array of node assets defined in this file.

properties.name: uv_set_library
properties.description: An array of uv_set assets defined in this file.

properties.name: modifier_library
properties.description: An array of modifier assets defined in this file.

properties.name: image_library
properties.description: An array of image assets defined in this file.

properties.name: material_library
properties.description: An array of material assets defined in this file.

properties.name: scene
properties.description: A scene object that instantiates and configures assets to add to a current scene.

details: A file must contain one or more of any of the *_library elements and/or a scene.

name: formula
description: Describes a set of operations and relationships to apply to a given property in the scene.

properties.name: output
properties.description: A string representing the object reference of the single-valued property to be targeted with the output from the formula.

properties.name: operations
properties.description: An ordered array of operation objects to apply, to derive the output value.

properties.name: stage
properties.description: A string representing the calculation stage that this formula’s output contributes to. May be one of “multiply” or “sum”. See Details section.

details:
The operations are given in Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) and applied in order. The output is the top-level operand remaining on the stack after applying all operations.

The operations array must contain at least one push operator and there must be at least one operand remaining on the stack at the end of the operation sequence, which will be pushed to the target channel. If the stack contains insufficient entries for a given operator, the results of that operator are undefined.

Multiple formulas may output to the same property, and if they do there must be some logic to determine how the results will be accumulated onto the property. The stage element allows a formula to specify how its output will be combined with other outputs that may target the same property. The current implementation supports a two-stage combiner. The outputs for all formulas that specify “multiply” as their stage will be multiplied together and the result multiplied by the sum of the outputs of all formulas that specify “sum” as their stage. 

output = (sum1+sum2+sum3+...sumN) * multi1 * multi2 * multi3 *...*multiN

More stages may be introduced in the future to support more complex combinations of outputs.

name: geometry
description: This is an asset that defines a polygon or subdivision mesh, including the region map, face grouping, material grouping, and reference to a default set of UV’s.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique ID for this asset within current file scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the internal name for the geometry.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user-readable label for the geometry.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string representing the type of mesh represented by the vertex and facet data.  Must be either “polygon_mesh” or “subdivision_surface”.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of any geometry asset that this asset was derived from.

properties.name: edge_interpolation_mode
properties.description: A string representing the type of edge interpolation to perform during subdivision. Must be one of “no_interpolation”, “edges_and_corners”, or “edges_only”. This is only valid when type is “subdivision_surface”.

properties.name: vertices
properties.description: A float3_array representing vertex positions of this geometry.

properties.name: polygon_groups
properties.description: A string_array representing the face group names for this geometry. Each name in the list must be unique within the list.

properties.name: polygon_material_groups
properties.description: A string_array representing the material group names for this geometry. Each name in the list must be unique within the list.

properties.name: polylist
properties.description: A counted array of polygon objects. Polygons may not contain holes.

properties.name: default_uv_set
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of a default UV set for this geometry.

properties.name: root_region
properties.description: A region object representing the root region in the region hierarchy.

properties.name: graft
properties.description: A graft object representing geometry grafting information, if this object is intended to graft.

properties.name: rigidity
properties.description: A rigidity object representing the rigidity map that controls how vertex weight maps should be projected onto this geometry.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

name: geometry_instance
description: Instantiates a geometry asset based on a geometry asset definition.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this instance within the file.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the geometry asset definition to instantiate.

details:
If the id property is not present, the geometry_instance becomes a reference used to look up a geometry instance within the currently loaded scene that uses the geometry definition given in the url field. Otherwise, it creates a new instance in the scene using the definition of the geometry asset given in the url field.

A geometry_instance may override any of the properties of the geometry asset it is based on, with the exception of the id property.

name: graft
description: Definition for how to graft one figure's geometry to another.

properties.name: vertex_count
properties.description: The number of vertices expected to exist in the target geometry.

properties.name: poly_count
properties.description: The number of polygons expected to exist in the target geometry.

properties.name: vertex_pairs
properties.description: A int2_array of vertex index pairs. The first index being the index into the source vertex list and the second index being the index into the target geometry vertex list.

properties.name: hidden_polys
properties.description: A int_array of polygon indices on the target geometry that should be hidden.

details:
The vertex_pairs property is composed of an array of vertex pairs where the first element in each pair is the index into the source geometry vertex array (i.e. the geometry that contains this snap_target definition), and the second element in each pair is the index into the vertex array for the target geometry.

The hidden_polys indices indicate which polygons on the target geometry should be hidden when the geometry for the snapping is attached.

name: image
description: Defines an image asset.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID for this instance within the file.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The internal name of the image.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the image asset that this image was derived from, if any.

properties.name: map_gamma
properties.description: A float representing the gamma of the image.

properties.name: map_size
properties.description: The preferred image size to apply to the composed map.

properties.name: map
properties.description: An array (stack) of image_map objects used to define per-pixel properties of the material channel.

details:
The map property defines a stack of images to be interpreted as individual layers. The first image in the stack defines the bottom layer, and each subsequent image represents an additional layer. The operation property of the layer is ignored for the bottom layer (first entry in the map array), but for other layers it defines how the image should be composited into the image chain. The map property must contain at least one image_map definition.

The map_gamma property defines the gamma of the image if a map property is present. A value that is less than or equal to zero (0) is interpreted to mean that it is up to the application to determine the gamma of the image. A value greater than zero (0) is interpreted to be the gamma encoding of the pixels in the image.

The map_size property defines the final image size of the output image if a map element is present, but also defines the size at which all layer images will be composited if more than one image is given in the map stack. If an image differs than this size upon import, it should be scaled to size before applying compositing operations in the map stack. The DSON format does not dictate whether image operations like scaling, rotating, and flipping should occur before or after any necessary image resizing in the map stack.

If the map_size element is missing when a map is present, the output size of the map stack is application-defined.

name: image_map
description: Defines an image map that can be composited with other image maps in a stack to define a single output map.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of an image file.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user-facing label for the image.

properties.name: active
properties.description:
A boolean value representing whether or not the layer is contributing to the final result.

Since file_version 0.6.1.0.

properties.name: color
properties.description: A float3 representing the R,G,B values as 0-1 values.

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: A float value representing the layer opacity in the [0,1] range, where 1 = opaque.

properties.name: invert
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether to invert the colors in the layer.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: A float value representing a rotation about the center point, given in degrees.

properties.name: xmirror
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether the source image will be mirrored across the horizontal (x) axis.

properties.name: ymirror
properties.description: A boolean value representing whether the source image will be mirrored across the vertical (y) axis.

properties.name: xscale
properties.description: A float value representing the scaling to apply along horizontal (x) axis.

properties.name: yscale
properties.description: A float value representing the scaling to apply along vertical (y) axis.

properties.name: xoffset
properties.description: A float value representing the normalized offset to apply along the horizontal (x) axis.

properties.name: yoffset
properties.description: A float value representing the normalized offset to apply along the vertical (y) axis.

properties.name: operation
properties.description:
A string representing the layer operation. Valid values are: alpha_blend, add, subtract and multiply.

As of file_version 0.6.1.0, the following values are also valid: blend_clear, blend_color_burn, blend_color_dodge, blend_darken, blend_destination, blend_destination_atop, blend_destination_in, blend_destination_out, blend_destination_over, blend_difference, blend_exclusion, blend_hard_light, blend_lighten, blend_multiply, blend_overlay, blend_plus, blend_screen, blend_soft_light, blend_source, blend_source_atop, blend_source_in, blend_source_out, blend_source_over, blend_xor.

details: The xoffset and yoffset are given in normalized coordinates such that a value of 1.0 offsets by the full image size in that dimension. Negative offset values are allowed.

name: light
description: Extra properties available for use if the node type is specified as “light”.

properties.name: color
properties.description: RGB color value for the light.

properties.name: point
properties.description: A light_point object definition, if this is a point light.

properties.name: directional
properties.description: A light_directional object definition, if this is a directional light.

properties.name: spot
properties.description: A light_spot object definition, if this is a spot light.

properties.name: on
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether the light is on.

details: Only one of point, directional, or spot may appear. If none are given, the light is an ambient light, in which case the light transform information does not affect the light.

name: light_directional
description: An object that defines properties of a directional light source.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Description

properties.name: intensity
properties.description: Light intensity, in the [0, 1] range

properties.name: shadow_type
properties.description: Type of shadowing to use for this light.  Valid values are “none”, “shadow_map”, and “raytraced”.

properties.name: shadow_softness
properties.description: If the light casts shadows, this is the softness factor to apply to the shadow.

properties.name: shadow_bias
properties.description: For shadow mapped shadows, this is the shadow bias.

name: light_point
description: An object that defines properties of a point light source.

properties.name: intensity
properties.description: Light intensity, in the [0, 1] range

properties.name: shadow_type
properties.description: Type of shadowing to use for this light.  Valid values are “none”, “shadow_map”, and “raytraced”.

properties.name: shadow_softness
properties.description: If the light casts shadows, this is the softness factor to apply to the shadow.

properties.name: shadow_bias
properties.description: For shadow mapped shadows, this is the shadow bias.

properties.name: constant_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: linear_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: quadratic_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

details:
The constant_attenuation, linear_attenuation, and quadratic_attenuation are used to calculate the total attenuation of this light given a distance. The equation used is:

color_scaling = constant_attenuation + ( Dist * linear_attenuation ) + (( Dist^2 ) * quadratic_attenuation )

name: light_spot
description: An object that defines properties of a spot light source.

properties.name: intensity
properties.description: Light intensity, in the [0, 1] range

properties.name: shadow_type
properties.description: Type of shadowing to use for this light.  Valid values are “none”, “shadow_map”, and “raytraced”.

properties.name: shadow_softness
properties.description: If the light casts shadows, this is the softness factor to apply to the shadow.

properties.name: shadow_bias
properties.description: For shadow mapped shadows, this is the shadow bias.

properties.name: constant_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: linear_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: quadratic_attenuation
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: falloff_angle
properties.description: See Details

properties.name: falloff_exponent
properties.description: See Details

details:
The constant_attenuation, linear_attenuation, and quadratic_attenuation are used to calculate the total attenuation of this light given a distance. The equation used is:

color_scaling = constant_attenuation + ( Dist * linear_attenuation ) + (( Dist^2 ) * quadratic_attenuation )

The falloff_angle and falloff_exponent are used to specify the amount of attenuation based on the direction of the light.

name: material
description: Definition of a material asset.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this asset within current file scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the internal name of the material.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user-readable default label.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the material asset that this asset was derived from, if any.

properties.name: uv_set
properties.description: A string representing the URI of a uv_set asset that should be active for this material.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string representing a hint for the receiving application about what type of shader to use (i.e. glass, metal, plastic, skin).

properties.name: diffuse
properties.description: A material_channel defining the diffuse for this material.

properties.name: diffuse_strength
properties.description: A material_channel defining the diffuse for this material.

properties.name: specular
properties.description: A material_channel defining the specular for this material.

properties.name: specular_strength
properties.description: A material_channel defining the specular for this material.

properties.name: glossiness
properties.description: A material_channel defining the glossiness for this material.

properties.name: ambient
properties.description: A material_channel defining the ambient for this material.

properties.name: ambient_strength
properties.description: A material_channel defining the ambient for this material.

properties.name: reflection
properties.description: A material_channel defining the reflection for this material.

properties.name: reflection_strength
properties.description: A material_channel defining the reflection for this material.

properties.name: refraction
properties.description: A material_channel defining the refraction for this material.

properties.name: refraction_strength
properties.description: A material_channel defining the refraction for this material.

properties.name: ior
properties.description: A material_channel defining the index of refraction for this material.

properties.name: bump
properties.description: A material_channel defining the bump for this material.

properties.name: bump_min
properties.description: A material_channel defining the bump min

properties.name: bump_max
properties.description: A material_channel defining the bump max

properties.name: displacement
properties.description: A material_channel defining the displacement for this material.

properties.name: displacement_min
properties.description: A material_channel defining the displacement min

properties.name: displacement_max
properties.description: A material_channel defining the displacement max

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: A material_channel defining the transparency for this material.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: A material_channel defining the normal map for this material.

properties.name: u_offset
properties.description: A material_channel defining the UV coordinate offset in the u direction.

properties.name: u_scale
properties.description: A material_channel defining the UV coordinate scale in the u direction.

properties.name: v_offfset
properties.description: A material_channel defining the UV coordinate offset in the v direction.

properties.name: v_scale
properties.description: A material_channel defining the UV coordinate scale in the v direction.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

details: Most of the fields in this definition are default values that may be overridden via a material_instance.
example:
{
    "id" : "bumpglass",
    "label" : "BumpyGlass",
    "type" : "glass",
    "diffuse" : material_channel,
    "diffuse_strength" : material_channel,
    "specular" : material_channel,
    "specular_strength" : material_channel,
    "glossiness" : material_channel,
    "ambient": material_channel,
    "reflection" : material_channel,
    "refraction" : material_channel,
    "ior" : material_channel,
    "bump" : material_channel,
    "bump_min" : material_channel,
    "bump_max" : material_channel,
    "transparency" : material_channel
}

name: material_channel
description: This object defines channel properties for a particular property of a material, such as diffuse color, specular color, etc. A material object will typically define a collection of material_channel objects to describe each property of the material.

properties.name: channel
properties.description: A channel definition.

properties.name: group
properties.description: A string representing a slash-delimited (“/”) path indicating the channel’s group for data pathing and presentation in the <abbr title="User Interface">UI</abbr>.

properties.name: color
properties.description: A float3 RGB color as a vector of values in the range [0, 1]

properties.name: strength
properties.description: A float strength value in range [0, 1]

properties.name: image
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> to a valid image file

details:
This type can be extended to include strength and color values that either multiply by the given map or act as the full value for the material channel.

At least one of strength or color is required to be present if image is present.

name: material_instance
description: Defines properties of a material binding for a collection of material groups.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier within the file

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the URI of a material asset definition to instantiate

properties.name: geometry
properties.description: A string representing the scene reference to a geometry definition to attach to.

properties.name: groups
properties.description: A string_array of polygon group names (see geometry) to attach the material to.

details: This is an instance class that may override defaults in the referenced material definition. All fields of the material definition, with the exception of the id and uv_set fields, may be overridden in this instance element.

name: modifier
description: This element defines an individual modifier asset for a morph, a skin binding, a channel, or an application-defined modifier type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique ID for this asset within current file scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the “internal” name for this object.  Generally unique within any sibling modifiers.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user-readable label for the modifier.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the modifier asset that this modifier was derived from, if any.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the parent definition.  A parent must appear above a child in the file.

properties.name: presentation
properties.description: A presentation containing metadata used to present an asset to the user, if this asset is a user-facing asset.

properties.name: channel
properties.description: A channel definition.

properties.name: region
properties.description: A string representing the region that the modifier should appear in.

properties.name: group
properties.description: A string representing a slash-delimited (“/”) path indicating the modifier’s group for data pathing and presentation in the <abbr title="User Interface">UI</abbr>.

properties.name: formulas
properties.description: An array of formula objects owned by this modifier.

properties.name: morph
properties.description: Any morph attached to this modifier.

properties.name: skin
properties.description: Any skin_binding attached to this modifier.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

details:
The morph and skin properties are mutually exclusive. A modifier may exist without either a morph or a skin defined, in which case it may become a data repository and a channel that can be used as input and output for a formula.

For any user-facing morphs, the region should be specified, so that the modifier can display in the interface for regional selection. Skin bindings and corrective morphs usually do not require any user presentation so do not need regions defined for them.

The name attribute may be used by applications to provide another addressing mechanism for nodes in the scene. In object URI’s, if “name” is used as the scheme identifier, then the value of the name attribute is used to look up an item rather than using the id attribute. If the name attribute is missing, applications should use the id attribute in its place wherever needed.

name: modifier_instance
description: This object instantiates a modifier.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this item within the scope of the file.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the node or element that this modifier instance is affecting.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the modifier asset definition to instantiate.

details: Most properties of modifier can be overridden in modifier_instance. The only properties that cannot be overridden are id and presentation. For any properties that are overridden which are URI’s, the URI must point to an instance element, not a definition.

name: morph
description: Defines a set of sparse morph deltas.

properties.name: vertex_count
properties.description: An int representing the number of vertices expected in the target geometry.

properties.name: deltas
properties.description: A float3_indexed_array of the morph deltas.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

name: named_string_map
description: Defines a mapping between face groups on geometry objects and nodes.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the name of the selection set.  Needs to be unique in the list of selection sets that this selection set belongs to.

properties.name: mappings
properties.description: An array of string pairs (face group name, node name) that define the mapping.

name: node
description: This object defines a node that makes up part of a node hierarchy. It can represent nodes of a variety of types such as bones and figure roots.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique ID for this asset within the current file scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the “internal” name for this node.  Generally unique within any sibling nodes.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A string representing the base type for this node. Can be “node”, “bone”, “figure”, “camera”, or “light”. See Extended By.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user facing label for this node.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the node asset that this node asset was derived from.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the parent node definition.  Parents must appear above children in the file.

properties.name: rotation_order
properties.description: A string representing the rotation order to use when interpreting channel-based animation data for this node.  Valid values are “XYZ”, “YZX”, “ZYX”, “ZXY”, “XZY”, and “YXZ”.

properties.name: inherits_scale
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the immediate parent node's local scale is compensated for when calculating this node's world space transform. If false, this node's world space transform is multiplied by the inverse of parent node's local scale.
properties.default: true (except for a bone with a bone parent)

properties.name: center_point
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the center point of this node.

properties.name: end_point
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the end point of this node.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the (Euler) rotation of this node.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the (Euler) rotation of this node.

properties.name: translation
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the translation of this node.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: An array of x, y, and z channel_float definitions for the individual (i.e. x, y, or z-axis) scale of this node.

properties.name: general_scale
properties.description: A channel_float definition for the general (i.e. 3-axis) scale of this node.

properties.name: presentation
properties.description: A presentation object representing the user-facing presentation information for this node.

properties.name: formulas
properties.description: An array of formula objects owned by this node.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

details:
If type is set to “figure” then this node is understood to be the root node of a figure.

The name attribute may be used by applications to provide another addressing mechanism for nodes in the scene. In object URI’s, if “name” is used as the scheme identifier, then the value of the name attribute is used to look up an item rather than using the id attribute. If the name attribute is missing, applications should use the id attribute in its place wherever needed.

The translation, rotation, scale, and general_scale elements each represent transforms that convert to transform matrices. To arrive at the full base transform for the node, each of those elements is converted to matrix form. The full transform for a node is determined using the following algorithm:

  • center_offset = center_point - parent.center_point
  • global_translation = parent.global_transform * (center_offset + translation)
  • global_rotation = parent.global_rotation * orientation * rotation * (orientation)-1
  • global_scale for nodes that inherit scale = parent.global_scale * orientation * scale * general_scale * (orientation)-1
  • global_scale for nodes = parent.global_scale * (parent.local_scale)-1 * orientation * scale * general_scale * (orientation)-1
  • global_transform = global_translation * global_rotation * global_scale

Vertices are taken to global space by post-multiplying as follows:

  • global_vertex = global_transform * vertex
example:
{
	"id" : "hip",
	"type" : "bone",
	"label" : "Hip",
	"parent" : "#Genesis",
	"rotation_order" : "YZX",
	"inherits_scale" : true,
	"center_point" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"end_point" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"orientation" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"rotation" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"translation" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"scale" : [
		channel_float,
		channel_float,
		channel_float
	],
	"general_scale" : channel_float
}

name: node_instance
description: This object instantiates a new node in the scene.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this instance within current file scope.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the URI to a node definition to be used to construct this node. The given node and all of its descendants are instantiated (i.e. not just the single node, unless it has no children).

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> to another scene node instance to attach to as a child.

properties.name: parent_in_place
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> to another scene node instance to attach to as a child, maintaining its world space transform.

properties.name: conform_target
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> to another node in the scene to follow.

properties.name: geometries
properties.description: An array of geometry_instance objects attached to this instance.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: A preview object to use as a stand-in if the node geometry cannot be found.

details:
The parent of a node_instance must already exist in the scene or must have been created by parsing the current scene (i.e. parent nodes must appear before children nodes in a file).

Most properties of node can be overridden in node_instance. The only properties that cannot be overridden are id, type, and presentation.

name: operation
description: Defines properties of a single operation in a formula operation stack.

properties.name: op
properties.description: Specifies the operator for the operation. See Details section.

properties.name: val
properties.description: Specifies the value to push onto the stack. See Details section.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Specifies the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of a property to evaluate and push onto the stack.

name: oriented_box
description: A 3D oriented box defined by a min and max point. The box will be axis-aligned in 3D space.

properties.name: min
properties.description: A float3 representing the minimum corner of the bounding box.

properties.name: max
properties.description: A float3 representing the maximum corner of the bounding box.

name: polygon
description: Defines an indexed polygon face.
details: A polygon can define no less than three, and no more than four, vertex indices. Any geometries that contain polygons with more than four vertices should be broken into triangles or quads for transport in DSON format.

name: presentation
description: Information and imagery describing how to present an asset to the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A content type path. (e.g. “Modifier/Pose”)

properties.name: label
properties.description: A user-friendly brief name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A sentence describing the item.

properties.name: icon_large
properties.description: An approximately 132 x 176 pixel image demonstrating the item.

properties.name: icon_small
properties.description: An approximately 66 x 88 pixel image demonstrating the item.

properties.name: colors
properties.description: An Array of two float3 RGB colors that are compatible with the icon image colors.

details:
At least the icon_large image must be given. If the icon_small image is missing, an application may need to downsize the icon_large image to use in areas of the interface that require smaller icons.

The type element is a discreet content type string as defined in the Content Types table.
example:
{
    "type" : "Modifier/Pose",
    "label" : "Smile",
    "description" : "A morph used to pose the mouth in the shape of a smile",
    "icon_large" : "/data/DAZ 3D/Genesis/Base/Morphs/DAZ 3D/Base/CTRLMouthSmileLarge.png",
    "icon_small" : "/data/DAZ 3D/Genesis/Base/Morphs/DAZ 3D/Base/CTRLMouthSmileSmall.png",
    "colors" : [ [ 0.25, 0.89, 0.98 ], [ 0.14, 0.73, 0.43 ] ]
}

name: preview
description: When an application attempts to load a file and is unable to locate one or more assets that are referenced in the file, the application may use a preview object to synthesize a stand-in billboard item in the scene that represents the missing asset.

properties.name: oriented_box
properties.description: An oriented_box that defines the bounding box of the stand-in item.

properties.name: center_point
properties.description: A float3 representing the center point of the item.

properties.name: end_point
properties.description: An float3 representing the end point of the stand-in object.

properties.name: rotation_order
properties.description: A string representing the rotation order to use when interpreting oriented_box data for this preview.  Valid values are “XYZ”, “YZX”, “ZYX”, “ZXY”, “XZY”, and “YXZ”.

name: region
description: Defines a hierarchy of regions using a series of vertex-weighted maps and region groups.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier within the region hierarchy.  Must be unique within the region hierarchy.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user-facing name of this region.

properties.name: display_hint
properties.description: A string representing an application-specific hint about how to display the value for the region. Values can be “cards_on”, “cards_off”, etc.

properties.name: map
properties.description: An int_array of indices for all the polygons that are members of this region.

properties.name: children
properties.description: An array of child regions, either leaf nodes or group nodes.

details:
The map and children elements are mutually exclusive. If a map element is given, the region is a leaf node in the region hierarchy and may not have children. If a children element is present, the region is a group node in the region hierarchy and may not define its own map. All leaf nodes in the hierarchy must define a map element.

Polygons may exist in one and only one region. If a polygon index is given in multiple regions, the behavior is undefined.

name: rigidity
description: Defines a rigidity map for a piece of geometry, and how it applies.

properties.name: weights
properties.description: A float_indexed_array of vertex weights.

properties.name: groups
properties.description: An array of rigidity_group objects.

name: rigidity_group
description: Defines a vertex group and how it participates in a rigidity map.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the Unique identifier within the file

properties.name: rotation_mode
properties.description: A string representing the rotation mode for the group.  Must be one of “none”, “full”, “primary”, or “secondary”

properties.name: scale_modes
properties.description: An array of the scale modes. Valid values for each axis are “none”, “primary”, “secondary”, or “tertiary”.

properties.name: reference_vertices
properties.description: An int_array of vertex indices for vertices in the reference geometry

properties.name: mask_vertices
properties.description: An int_array of vertex indices from the rigidity mask

properties.name: reference
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the reference node

properties.name: transform_nodes
properties.description: An array of <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> to use when calculating the transform offset for the rigid geometry

details: The order of the values in scale_modes depends on the set up of the rigidity group. If there are transform_nodes they are in the rotation order of those nodes. If there is a reference node and no transform_nodes it uses the reference node’s axis order. Finally, if there is no reference node or scale nodes it is in the axis order of the calculated reference axis.

name: scene
description:
Defines a scene, which is a collection of new instances (with applicable hook-ups into what may already be in the scene) and property settings.

Scene objects can exist in either a DUF or a DSF file, but only one scene object can exist per file. Scene objects are typically in the user facing DUF files. A scene object can represent either an entire scene (scene replacement) or to augment or replace parts of a scene.

properties.name: presentation
properties.description: A presentation object representing information to be displayed to the user.

properties.name: nodes
properties.description: An array of node_instance objects to add to the scene.

properties.name: uvs
properties.description: An array of uv_set_instance objects to add to the scene.

properties.name: modifiers
properties.description: An array of modifier_instance objects to add to the scene.

properties.name: materials
properties.description: An array of material_instance objects to assign to geometries in the scene.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: An array of channel_animation objects.

properties.name: current_camera
properties.description: A string representing the URI of a camera node_instance within the scene to use as the current camera.

properties.name: extra
properties.description: An array of objects that represent additional application-specific information for this object.

example:
{
	"nodes" : [
		node_instance,
		node_instance,
		...
	],
	"materials" : [
		material_instance,
		material_instance,
		...
	],
	"extra" : [
		{
			"type" : "studio_scene_settings",
			"current_time" : 0,
			"background_color" : [ 0.3686275, 0.3686275, 0.3686275 ]
		},
		{
			"type" : "studio_render_settings",
			"render_options" : {
				"aspect_ratio" : [ 827, 983 ],
				"startTime" : 0,
				"endTime" : 1,
				"renderMovToId" : "MovieFile",
				"isAspectConstrained" : true,
				"imageSize" : [ 827, 983 ],
				"renderType" : "Software",
				"renderStyle" : "Normal",
				"rayTraceDepth" : 2,
				"openGLPasses" : 8,
				"useGLSL" : true,
				"isCurrentFrameRender" : true,
				"xPixelSamples" : 4,
				"yPixelSamples" : 4,
				"shadowSamples" : 16,
				"shadingRate" : 1,
				"doubleSided" : true,
				"gain" : 1,
				"gamma" : 1,
				"pixelFilter" : "Sinc",
				"xFilterWidth" : 6,
				"yFilterWidth" : 6
			}
		}
	]
}

name: skin_binding
description: A skin_binding defines the offsets and weights that relate a skin (geometry) to a skeleton (a collection of nodes).

properties.name: node
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the root node to bind to.

properties.name: geometry
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the geometry to bind.

properties.name: vertex_count
properties.description: An int representing the number of vertices expected in the mesh geometry.

properties.name: joints
properties.description: An array of weighted_joint objects defining the binding.

properties.name: selection_sets
properties.description: A named_string_map that provides a one to one mapping from face groups to nodes.

name: uv_set
description: The definition of a single UV coordinate set asset.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing a unique ID for this asset within the current file scope.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A string representing the “internal” name for this UV set.  Generally unique within any sibling uv sets.

properties.name: label
properties.description: A string representing the user facing label for this UV set.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the uv_set asset that this uv_set was derived from, if any.

properties.name: vertex_count
properties.description: An int representing the number of vertices expected to be in the geometry that the UV set applies to.

properties.name: uvs
properties.description: A float2_array of all UV's, both those that are shared by all polygons attached to a vertex, and those that may be unique to a particular polygon attached to a vertex.

properties.name: polygon_vertex_indices
properties.description: An array representing the polygons that use a UV index for a given vertex that is different than the default index defined in “uvs”. Polygon-specific vertex-indexed UV indices. Each entry is [polygon_index, polygon_vertex_index, uv_index], where polygon_vertex_index refers to the index of a vertex in the geometry that is used by the polygon at polygon_index.

details: The uvs array is assumed to be given in the same order as the vertices in any associated geometry. Any vertices that have more than one UV coordinate associated with them (e.g. along a UV boundary) should appear in the polygon_vertex_indices array. For vertices that appear in the polygon_vertex_indices array, their entry in the uvs array should correspond to a “primary” value for the UV's for that vertex. The “primary” value may be arbitrary for most applications.

name: uv_set_instance
description: Defines an instance of a uv_set asset.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this asset within the current file scope.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the uv_set definition to instantiate.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: A string representing the URI of the geometry that the UV set should attach to.

name: weighted_joint
description: Defines one of the joints in a skin binding. For now, the binding matrix for each node is assumed to be the identity matrix.

properties.name: id
properties.description: A string representing the unique identifier for this object within the file scope.

properties.name: node
properties.description: A string representing the <abbr title="Uniform Resource Identifier">URI</abbr> of the target node in the skeleton.

properties.name: node_weights
properties.description: A float_indexed_array representing the general weight map for this joint.

properties.name: scale_weights
properties.description: A float_indexed_array representing the scale weight map for this joint.

properties.name: local_weights
properties.description: A collection of x, y, and z float_indexed_array objects representing the local weights for the joint.

properties.name: bulge_weights
properties.description: A collection of x, y, and z bulge_binding objects representing the bulge binding weights for the joint.

details: * At least one of node_weights, scale_weights, and/or local_weights must be present.
example:
{
    "id" : "rForeArm",
    "node" : "#rForeArm",
    "scale_weights" : {
        "count" : 101,
        "values" : [
            [ 111, 0.00218204 ],
            [ 122, 0.004913405 ],
            [ 123, 0.009918365 ],
            ...
            [ 292, 1.525902e-05 ],
            [ 314, 7.629511e-05 ],
            [ 315, 0.0001525902 ],
            [ 316, 9.155413e-05 ],
            [ 327, 3.051804e-05 ]
        ]
    },
    "local_weights" : {
        "y" : {
            "count" : 129,
            "values" : [
                [ 84, 0.0003051804 ],
                [ 85, 0.0002441444 ],
                [ 86, 0.0002288853 ],
                [ 87, 0.0002441444 ],
                ...
                [ 949, 0.001129168 ],
                [ 950, 0.0009918364 ],
                [ 983, 0.001327535 ],
                [ 984, 0.001205463 ],
                [ 1017, 0.0006561379 ],
                [ 1018, 0.0007782101 ]
            ]
        },
    },
    "bulge_weights" : {
        "y" : {
            "bulges" : [
                {
                    "id" : "positive-left",
                    "label" : "Y Bulge Positive Left",
                    "visible" : false,
                    "locked" : false,
                    "min" : -10000,
                    "max" : 10000,
                    "clamped" : false,
                    "display_as_percent" : false,
                    "step_size" : 0.01,
                    "value" : -10,
                    "auto_follow" : true
                },
                {
                    "id" : "positive-right",
                    "label" : "Y Bulge Positive Right",
                    "visible" : false,
                    "locked" : false,
                    "min" : -10000,
                    "max" : 10000,
                    "clamped" : false,
                    "display_as_percent" : false,
                    "step_size" : 0.01,
                    "value" : 6.99999,
                    "auto_follow" : true
                },
                {
                    "id" : "negative-left",
                    "label" : "Y Bulge Negative Left",
                    "visible" : false,
                    "locked" : false,
                    "min" : -10000,
                    "max" : 10000,
                    "clamped" : false,
                    "display_as_percent" : false,
                    "step_size" : 0.01,
                    "value" : 0,
                    "auto_follow" : true
                },
                {
                    "id" : "negative-right",
                    "label" : "Y Bulge Negative Right",
                    "visible" : false,
                    "locked" : false,
                    "min" : -10000,
                    "max" : 10000,
                    "clamped" : false,
                    "display_as_percent" : false,
                    "step_size" : 0.01,
                    "value" : -10,
                    "auto_follow" : true
                }
            ],
            "right_map" : {
                "count" : 347,
                "values" : [
                    [ 24, 0.01115435 ],
                    [ 25, 0.01074235 ],
                    [ 26, 0.01110857 ],
                    [ 27, 0.01213092 ],
                    [ 28, 0.01341268 ],
                    ...
                    [ 1013, 0.06436256 ],
                    [ 1014, 0.0669871 ],
                    [ 1015, 0.06668193 ],
                    [ 1016, 0.03700313 ],
                    [ 1017, 0.009948882 ]
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
